item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Rule number one: Don't fuck with librarians." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Harold Howe
item.description: "What a school thinks about its library is a measure of what it feels about education." -- Harold Howe

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Adult librarians are like lazy bakers: their patrons want a jelly doughnut, so they give them a jelly doughnut. Children’s librarians are ambitious bakers: 'You like the jelly doughnut? I’ll get you a jelly doughnut. But you should try my cruller, too. My cruller is gonna blow your mind, kid." -- John Green

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Google can bring you back 100,000 answers. A librarian can bring you back the right one." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It is a feeling of relief, almost of pleasure, at knowing yourself at last genuinely down and out. You have talked so often of going to the dogs - and well, here are the dogs, and you have reached them, and you can stand it. It takes off a lot of anxiety." -- George Orwell

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "The further one goes, the less one knows." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "You have a grand gift for silence, Watson. It makes you quite invaluable as a companion." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data. Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "I have this disease late at night sometimes, involving alcohol and the telephone." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "If this is going to be a Christian nation that doesn't help the poor, either we have to pretend that Jesus was just as selfish as we are, or we've got to acknowledge that He commanded us to love the poor and serve the needy without condition and then admit that we just don't want to do it." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "The most merciful thing in the world, I think, is the inability of the human mind to correlate all its contents. We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far. The sciences, each straining in its own direction, have hitherto harmed us little; but some day the piecing together of dissociated knowledge will open up such terrifying vistas of reality, and of our frightful position therein, that we shall either go mad from the revelation or flee from the light into the peace and safety of a new dark age." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Rick Yancey
item.description: "He knew the truth. <i>Yes, my dear child,</i> he would undoubtedly tell a terrified toddler tremulously seeking succor, <i>monsters are real. I happen to have one hanging in my basement.</i>" -- Rick Yancey

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Rick Yancey
item.description: "There are times when fear is <i>not</i> our enemy. There are times when fear is our truest, sometimes <i>only</i>, friend." -- Rick Yancey

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "If you will comply with my conditions, I will leave them and you at peace; but if you refuse, I will glut the maw of death, until it be satiated with the blood of your remaining friends." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "If I cannot inspire love, I will cause fear!" -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "Life, although it may only be an accumulation of anguish, is dear to me, and I will defend it." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Rick Yancey
item.description: "England is home to one of the most unattractive people on earth!" He glared at Walker. "You are the perfect example." -- Rick Yancey

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "There will come a time when it isn't 'They're spying on me through my phone' anymore. Eventually, it will be 'My phone is spying on me'." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most people don't realize how important librarians are. I ran across a book recently which suggested that the peace and prosperity of a culture was solely related to how many librarians it contained. Possibly a slight overstatement. But a culture that doesn't value its librarians doesn't value ideas and without ideas, well, where are we?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Spider Robinson
item.description: "Librarians are the secret masters of the world. They control information. Don't ever piss one off. " -- Spider Robinson

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Library Avengers
item.description: "People become librarians because they know too much. Their knowledge extends beyond mere categories. They cannot be confined to disciplines. Librarians are all-knowing and all-seeing. They bring order to chaos. They bring wisdom and culture to the masses. They preserve every aspect of human knowledge. Librarians rule. And they will kick the crap out of anyone who says otherwise. --libraryavengers.org" -- Library Avengers

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Marilyn Johnson
item.description: "Librarians consider free access to information the foundation of democracy." -- Marilyn Johnson

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mo Willems
item.description: "All of the life-changing awesome words and pictures and ideas inside your library are useless without just one word outside your library: Open." -- Mo Willems

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "There's no use going to school unless your final destination is the library." -- Ray Bradbury
